title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats were rescued from a hoarding situation in a 1,200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island.
The Rhode Island Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals reports some cats are pregnant and have respiratory illnesses.
The shelter requests donations for supplies and medical care for the cats rescued from the hoarding incident.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran is potentially seeing more Designated Hitter (DH) reps due to the Red Sox's crowded outfield.
Duran, although part of trade rumors, hasn't been informed of a move to team DH, emphasizing flexibility in roles.
Duran reflects on a challenging 2025 season and aims to improve after a drop in batting average and OPS.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jordan Harris launches Harris' Huskies to support hockey accessibility for underserved youth in Massachusetts.
Harris partners with SCORE Boston, offering equipment, ice time, and clinics to break barriers in access to hockey.
The Harris' Huskies clinic at Warrior Ice Arena involved former Northeastern hockey players and aimed to inspire young athletes.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Simmons predicts Jayson Tatum will return to the Celtics by March 1, 2026, after Achilles tendon injury.
NBC's trailer for Tatum's docuseries, 'The Quiet Work,' hints at his return during a March primetime Celtics game.
Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 practice, indicating progress in his rehabilitation and a potential early March return.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Massachusetts State Police trooper injured when a car hit his SUV on I-95 South in Salisbury.
Josue Levi Cuevas Santana, 24, identified as driver; faces multiple charges including negligent operation and speeding.
Trooper released from Portsmouth Regional Hospital for at-home recovery; incident highlights highway safety concerns.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel set an Olympic record with three shutouts in a single women's hockey tournament.
Frankel helped Team USA defeat Sweden 5-0, advancing to the gold-medal game against Canada.
Frankel and Gwyneth Philips broke the Olympic shutout record, keeping opponents scoreless for 331:23 minutes.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died and her husband went missing after falling through ice in Eastham on February 14.
Rescue teams found the woman's body on Saturday, but a search for the husband was suspended due to low visibility.
Officials will resume searching for the husband when ice conditions improve to allow safe access.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants after a disagreement over playing first base.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment at Devers' refusal to switch to first base after an injury.
Red Sox CEO Sam Kennedy acknowledged the franchise might have handled Devers' position change differently.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy addressed criticism that the Red Sox lack commitment to winning, emphasizing their intent is proven by their payroll.
Rafael Devers was traded to the Giants after tensions arose over Bregman's signing, impacting his role on the team.
Alex Bregman left Boston for the Cubs, reportedly due to contract negotiation issues, including a no-trade clause.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the shooter, died and three were injured in a shooting at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, Rhode Island.
Authorities identified the shooter as Robert Dorgan; the incident was a targeted family dispute, Pawtucket police confirmed.
Rhode Island Governor Dan McKee stated state police are assisting local law enforcement in the investigation at Lynch Arena.
